The method Assert.assertThrows provides a nicer way for verifying exceptions. In addition the use of  <file_name>  is error-prone when used with other rules like TestWatcher because the order of rules is important in that case.

Decision: Disable parts of doclint for the site's javadoc
Rationale: That commit is missing to apply the doclint rules to site generation. Hence the site goal fails because of doclint issues. Now doclint is disabled for all groups but accessibility and reference for the site generation.

Only use a property where multiple entries need syncing
Rationale: Using properties to define a shared version across multiple dependencies causes less issues when you have multiple dependencies that need to be kept in sync

Decision: No  <file_name>  class, interceptors turned on by default
Delete all constructors created since <version> was released. Fix style issues.

Create <file_name> in org.junit.runners.model and deprecate the one in org.junit.internal.runners.model. Update <file_name> to have a useful message. This allows developers who write custom runners to properly handle multiple exceptions without depending on internal classes.
Rationale: Provides a more organized structure for custom runners and reduces dependencies on internal classes.
